task: Prepare literature review on genome editing

section.content: CRISPR-Cas9 has revolutionized genome editing by providing a precise, programmable system for targeted DNA modifications. The system consists of two key components: a guide RNA (gRNA) that specifies the genomic target, and the Cas9 endonuclease that cuts the DNA...

section.text: RECENT ADVANCES IN GENE EDITING TECHNOLOGIES
section.content: The field of gene editing has experienced unprecedented growth in recent years, with several breakthrough technologies emerging. Base editing and prime editing represent significant advances beyond traditional CRISPR-Cas9 systems...

Germline genome editing raises profound ethical questions that the scientific community must address. Unlike somatic cell editing, germline modifications are heritable and affect future generations...

Clinical applications of genome editing show particular promise for treating monogenic disorders. Sickle cell disease and beta-thalassemia have emerged as leading targets for therapeutic genome editing...
Despite the precision of modern genome editing tools, off-target effects remain a critical concern for therapeutic applications. Comprehensive assessment of unintended modifications is essential...
